Articles.Content:
Interesting graphical issue under the engine there, in the beginning of the first video.

[edit]

Also, that\'s a very strong engine you have there; you clipped the tip of it at just over 44 m/s. Your cockpit also hit the hitch in the terrain there at around 35 m/s.

[/edit]

Interesting graphical issue under the engine there, in the beginning of the first video.

[edit]

Also, that\'s a very strong engine you have there; you clipped the tip of it at just over 44 m/s. Your cockpit also hit the hitch in the terrain there at around 35 m/s.

[/edit]

The shadow engine is still pretty bad. Better than no real time shadows at all right?

i know the small 'flying' return capsules tend to have a parragliding parachute, to produce lift and compensate for the poor wing lift. is this possible to make in KSP yet, or do parrachutes only reduce kinetic energy in the direction of travel?

I actually plan on having such a parachute, but semininja is right, it can only apply drag.

One question...drag chute? Been trying to get the radial mounted chute to connect to the vanguard and it won\'t. Although doesn\'t the game engine eject the parachute the second your on the ground anyway?

In the absence of aerodynamic lift, this is probably going to be the main function of the parachute.

It might also be useful for water landings.

Also, that\'s a very strong engine you have there; you clipped the tip of it at just over 44 m/s. Your cockpit also hit the hitch in the terrain there at around 35 m/s.

All the parts have extremely high crashTolerance for testing.

I may lower the values later, but I don\'t want to make the plane too difficult to land.

Can\'t wait for the update... the Ausplane and the radial-mounting-ness!

Am super-stoked!

Hey slew. yes you!

Your awesome. 8)
Love the plane. First thought watching it, though: 'It\'s like a fat Vanguard with toast on the bottom' =P
Are you going to / is it possible to add landing gear?

Are you going to / is it possible to add landing gear?

No landing gear, unfortunately.

Love the plane. First thought watching it, though: 'It\'s like a fat Vanguard with toast on the bottom' =P

Thanks, Nova. Glad you like it.

Love the plane. First thought watching it, though: 'It\'s like a fat Vanguard with toast on the bottom' =P

I think the fat one is better than your tall Vanguard, but it is okay

oO(for the moment )
so...anything? i mean, i know that part makers don\'t like to be rushed so i haven\'t commented on this thread as of late BUT I AM JIZZING IN MY PANTS with anticipation...how much longer man?

so...anything? i mean, i know that part makers don\'t like to be rushed so i haven\'t commented on this thread as of late BUT I AM JIZZING IN MY PANTS with anticipation...how much longer man?

This weekend.
I CAN\'T WAIT ANYMORE ??? ;P :-[ :-[ 8) ??? : > : : : ;P :-* =P =P

I really can\'t wait. Are you going to include a launcher craft file? So people can try your Ausplane without fumbling about with different rockets.

Seems like a good idea to me.

I really can\'t wait. Are you going to include a launcher craft file? So people can try your Ausplane without fumbling about with different rockets.

Seems like a good idea to me.

Yeah, once I figure out the best design.
The Ausplane looks terrific, but I am wondering if it is possible to attach anything to the nose of the craft. It would be handy later on, considering the developmental push for space stations.

bring it out (<- Worse! xD)

we can remake the texture ourself

oO(I\'ll make this)
Ausplane is out.

thx, I love it!!!

Could you make a green one??

Very nice Design ! Thx !

However, the shuttle is nearly uncontrolable above 80m/s under 5\'000m. Do you have some advices to handle it ? (despite the current atmospherix model)

Very nice Design ! Thx !

However, the shuttle is nearly uncontrolable above 80m/s under 5\'000m. Do you have some advices to handle it ? (despite the current atmospherix model)

What\'s happening? Is it pitching down?
It\'s pitching up, at least in my experience.

It\'s pitching up, at least in my experience.

That\'s odd, I usually see pitching down due to low velocity.

But I fly planes with joysticks usually.
even for me... it\'s always pitching up with SAS and RSC activated

What\'s happening? Is it pitching down?

It\'s pitching up. until near 90Â° up. But i\'m confident in Slew, \'cause the problem is almost certainly the atmospheric model. I can\'t believe a wing build lift at 40+Â° attack angle, evan a Kerbal one =P

It\'s pitching up. until near 90Â° up. But i\'m confident in Slew, \'cause the problem is almost certainly the atmospheric model. I can\'t believe a wing build lift at 40+Â° attack angle, evan a Kerbal one =P

It also may have to do with the game lacking proper wings.
